intro: Sacoglottis reticulata, commonly known as the netted sacoglottis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive net-like venation on its leaves, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The species is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
